872949333:
[

Graduate Product Engineer

Company Name Reece Group Company Location Dandenong South, Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 45 views

Be an early applicant

Job description


About Reece
Reece Group is an Australian icon. You probably know us as Australia's largest supplier of plumbing and bathroom products. We have been around for almost 100 years. But that's just one side of us. We're a major public company with over 5,000 people, 600 branches and 9 businesses in Australia and New Zealand and have just expanded to America after our recent acquisition of MORSCO. We thrive on new ideas and have the courage to make them happen. That means endless opportunities to achieve amazing things.

Our team are committed, down to earth and driven people striving for greatness every day.

We sell millions of products under hundreds of brands, many that we've created. We manage the R&D and quality of our range through an in-house lab to meet the needs of a rapidly changing market. So, we know product quality, and we're happy to share.

The Opportunity
The Reece Group Graduate Program has been rated consistently in the top 100 finalists by GradConnection. We are pleased to be recognised in the top 30 for 2018.

Upon completion of the 24-month program, you will secure a role within the Test Lab team based in our National Distribution Centre located in Dandenong, VIC.

Here's a breakdown of the program:

  • You're allocated a mentor as you commence the program to guide your growth and development
  • Throughout the program you'll progress through a training plan with regular feedback and support
  • In the first 12 months, you'll immerse yourself in the business working within one or more of our 600+ stores to become an expert in our products, learn who our customers are and gain an understanding of our systems which will include:
    • Serving customers (Selling products and processing orders)
    • Inwards Goods (receipting and putting away stock and receiving orders)
    • Doing deliveries (delivering goods out to site for our customers)
    • Answering phones, taking orders and serving customers
    • Customer account development
  • In your second year, you'll join our Lab team and we'll get you fully up to speed with everything involved in New Product Development, and After Sales Testing.
    • Over this period you will look at products across various industry sectors and will cover everything from certification, specification, testing, report writing, and much more.


Skills and Experience

  • Recent University Graduates or final year students with an Engineering or Science degree
  • Ability to make quick decisions in a fast-paced environment
  • Expertise-based problem-solving skills
  • Capable of working on simultaneous projects
  • Strong communication and collaboration skills


Why Work With Us
Most organisations say they live by their values. We actually do. We also hire by them and promote by them. They are a major reason why we are such a strong and happy company.

Take a look for yourself: https://www.reececareers.com.au/

What's In It For You
Reece prioritises career development for internal staff and demonstrated success in this role will set you up for further growth and development opportunities.

Here are some other reasons why you should consider us:

  • A permanent position at the very start of your Graduate Program
  • 3-day induction held in Melbourne
  • Structured learning, development and leadership programs
  • Study allowance for a flexible career
  • Opportunities to work in various branches across AUS and NZ
  • Profit share program


Application Process
Please submit the following documents as part of your application:

  • Resume
  • Academic Transcript


If this sounds like the opportunity you've been looking for, we would love to hear from you. Apply today!

To be eligible for the Reece Group Graduate Program, you need to be an Australian citizen or permanent resident at the time of application. Applicants must be willing to undertake a background check and references.

Industry

  • Consumer Goods
  • Retail

Employment Type

Full-time

Job Functions

  • Engineering
]

[

Chief Risk Officer

Company Name Tandem Corp - formerly ISG Management Company Location Level 1, 417 St Kilda Road. , Melbourne, VIC 3004, AU

New Posted Date Posted 4 hours ago Number of views 24 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Chief Risk Officer

\xa0

Company Description


Tandem is an ingenious, fast-moving workforce design and delivery company. We transform the usual service outcomes of large businesses, into exceptional customer experiences.

Our innovative service delivery model challenges the norm, by delivering excellent service outcomes simply and at least cost.
\xa0

Position Summary:


Tandem now has an opportunity for a Chief Risk Officer to join its Head Office based in Melbourne. Reporting directly to the CFO and leading a small team, the Chief Risk Officer (CRO) will be accountable for the development of risk policy, practices, capability and risk culture as well as the enterprise view of risk management.

\xa0

Additionally, the CRO is central in the management of Board Audit and Risk Committee reporting, Business Unit compliance review programs, \xa0risk registers and providing advice and coaching on risk to the executive and Board on day to day issues. .

\xa0

The CRO will ensure that Tandem employees are involved in and understand risk and compliance requirements at every level, including how they are communicated, measured and monitored.


Other responsibilities include:


  • Ensuring that Tandem’s client’s risk, compliance and assurance requirements are understood across the existing and emerging businesses and that business frameworks are developed and monitored to meet these requirements.
  • Lead the development of risk policy and practices regarding credit, liquidity, market (rates and derivatives) and operations (compliance, fraud, systems and IT failure, physical and logical security and regulation).
  • Lead the development of the enterprise view of risk management by assessing the status of key enterprise risks, recommending and leading in risk mitigation, and preparing risk assessments on business ventures and change initiatives (including portfolio impact).


To be considered for this role we are seeking a Degree qualified professional that has CRO experience in large complex businesses and who can demonstrate independent thinking and problem solving ability along with a deep knowledge of modern risk, compliance and best audit practice. Post grad qualifications will be an advantage along with Big 4 experience.


Why you should apply


Join TANDEM and you will be part of a high energy team with a supportive culture. In addition to competitive salaries, we offer incentives and rewards that are designed to recognise high performance. Our leadership team works with you to make sure you have the tools and support to do your job exceptionally well so that you can achieve your goals.


Please Note - the successful candidate/s for this position will be asked to consent to a police check. \xa0


By applying for this role you agree to Tandem collecting, using and disclosing your personal information as set out in our Privacy Policy \xa0
http://www.tandemcorp.com/privacy-policy/

\xa0

\xa0

873978003:
[

Senior Software Engineer

Company Name Equiem Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 34 minutes ago Number of views 5 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

THE ROLE

As a Senior Software Engineer, your primary role is to develop scalable and maintainable code that signifies the engineering craft at Equiem, in a timely manner and in collaboration with the rest of the product delivery team you are working with.


As a Senior Software Engineer at Equiem you will contribute to building a suite of software applications that enable commercial and retail buildings to create communities, enhancing the overall experience during their tenancy and solving the problems and inconveniences faced by the building’s occupants.


An understanding of the evolving role of the software engineer is critical, as developers are not only expected to code, but to engage in discussions with Product Owners on the problems faced by our users, own the technical and functional quality of their output, deploy, monitor and troubleshoot in production.


Equiem is growing rapidly and with it, our team and ideas! Our teams are driven by motivated and talented people who work together in a highly creative, lean, continuous delivery cycle. We want to solve the problems our users are facing with quality and expeditious!


WHO ARE WE?

We are Equiem. We take pride in our company culture, our products & our people.

Changing the world one square metre at a time, our online platform creates hyper-local communities in office towers, residential apartments and retail shopping centres globally. We deliver a hotel like experience for happier workers, more productive relationships between tenants and enhanced building efficiency. Think coffee, lunch and dry cleaning delivered to your desk, thriving interest groups and concierge services which rival the best in the world. Based on the understanding that skyscrapers often house more people than a country town, we transform buildings into workplace communities ("vertical communities") and help landlords attract and retain tenants while providing powerful data insights to better meet their needs.


WHO ARE YOU?

Your greatest strength is possessing a deep understanding of modern web frameworks and the best practise approaches to software engineering. \xa0You have a DevOps mindset, ensuring that CI, CD and infrastructure are automated. ‘When changing existing code leave it in a better state than it previously was’ is what you believe and this is reflected in your thought process and creations.


This role will involve mentoring and coaching but will also see you being hands-on in delivery.

  • Actively own and manages your work end to end, clarify requirements as needed and actively taking part in workshops and other sprint planning ceremonies

  • Are accountable for the quality of your work, ensuring all new code is maintainable, secure and performant and is adequately tested

  • Contribute to architecture discussions and takes ownership of Design at a component level as\xa0required


The finer points

  • 5+ years in commercial application development for mid-sized software/product company in the digital/SaaS space

  • Proven commercial experience in working on a tech stack that includes extensive use of Javascript, APIs, microservices and cloud infrastructure

  • Demonstrated full stack skills and understanding

  • Possess strong analytical & problem-solving skills, demonstrating acute troubleshooting abilities

  • Possess a practical understanding of Agile and Lean development practices

  • You get work done!


If you embrace change, are super flexible and are looking to work in a small team that will challenge AND support you; are sometimes serious and sometimes playful...let's talk.


You'll be working in Head Office, in Melbourne CBD, right at the heart of our company.


Culture & Benefits

At Equiem, we take pride in our culture and focus on our people. We have maintained a “startup” culture despite growing exponentially in the last 5 years. This means you will have a voice, and an opportunity to own your role and truly make a mark and impact in the company’s growth ambitions. Unlike a large corporation, we are agile and move quickly, meaning you will be making key decisions frequently and will be able to learn and grow in an accelerated rate compared to a traditional “big business” environment. We have a close-knit “startup” family culture -- full of hardworking, driven, talented team members. We help each other and celebrate our wins together.


Beyond receiving a competitive salary and bonus opportunity, we also offer:

  • Flexible work arrangements (time & place) - we don't watch what time you clock in and out, you’re a grown up, we trust you know what you need to do to get the job done

  • We think the day you were born is a special day, so celebrate and take the day off...and still get paid!

  • Friday! We all enjoy Fridays, so start the day with team breakfast and end the day with a social drink - a Corona, Chardonnay or Coke your choice


Think big. Think long-term. Be prepared. And excited. If this sounds like you..let’s talk! Apply now via LinkedIn (don't forget to attach your resume!)


*Please note this is a full-time position. As such, we can only accept applicants with full, unrestricted work rights for Australia.


No recruiters, please.

Senior E-Commerce Marketing Manager - Sand & Sky

Company Name Supernova Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 3 hours ago Number of views 20 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

About Supernova


We are the fastest growing health & beauty social e-commerce company. We build health and beauty products for a new generation of women worldwide. Independently owned with a global marketing reach and offices in Los Angeles, London, Singapore, New Delhi and Melbourne, we connect with over 12 million women on social media every week.

\xa0

About Supernova’s Internal Engine


Together we create Superstars! Our three company pillars are guided by this motto: Our product and brands are of the highest quality and within the top five in their category; our customers are the focus of our actions and their lives improve with our products; our talent and employees grow and develop within Supernova.

This means that investing in hiring, developing and retaining the brightest minds in the world is a top priority. Living our core values of #GetSh*tDone, #TalkAboutIt, #CreateValue, #SeekNewOpportunities and #MoveForwardTogether creates a unique culture across five different time zones and allows us to realise the enormous potential of this exciting industry. If you’re an ambitious, smart, natural collaborator who likes taking risks, influencing, and innovating in a challenging hyper-growth environment, we’d love to talk to you about joining our team.

\xa0

About Sand&Sky


We love beauty, skincare, the beach and this great southern land!

Sand&Sky is the fastest growing digital native beauty company. We are young and ambitious, with our eyes focussed on becoming the most exciting Australian skincare brand. In just 12 months we have grown our cult brand into a market leader in over 50 countries around the world. An exciting future lies ahead as we begin to expand our unique product offerings and begin to grow our online and retail impact.

Based in the heart of Melbourne, this role provides tremendous opportunity for the right candidate: to capture the energy and rapid pace of a fast growing start up, while being responsible for a sizeable and growing part of our global footprint.

\xa0

About the Job


The Senior E-Commerce Marketing Manager is one of the most exciting positions available within the Supernova Family for the right performance marketing driven individual. This position is for an exceptional and ambitious person, who loves the beauty and skincare industry as much as marketing, and who will work directly with our Co-Founder to drive sales and acquisitions for the Sand & Sky brand.


For this exciting opportunity, we are looking for and exceptional senior digital marketing manager who is KPI and metric driven. You are ambitious, highly numbers driven yet creative and knows E-Commerce and Social E-Commerce inside out.


Job Role


  • Assist the Co-Founder of the Brand to set Direct channel targets
  • Own and implement strategies to hit direct channel sales and performance targets
  • Develop and implement the strategy for the expansion and management of the eCommerce marketing channels
  • Develop fresh and innovative campaigns ideas, collaborating closely with different teams to implement them
  • Develop and manage digital marketing campaigns - Together with our specialised teams in Facebook marketing, search marketing, affiliate marketing, social media marketing and email marketing
  • Analyse and track performance results; be ready to adjust approach accordingly and provide ongoing recommendations for increasing sales and improving the efficiency of marketing campaigns and messages
  • Devise strategies to drive traffic and sales via Social Media channels
  • Identify key trends in performance marketing and Social Media marketing in order to develop effective customer acquisition strategies
  • Lead website updates and initiatives to constantly improve the customer journey and tactics to increase conversion, deuce bounce rate and basket abandonment
  • Manage the Online Marketing Specialist providing line management and coaching
  • Eventually build and manage a team of creative digital marketers

\xa0

Your Profile


  • You live and breathe sales performance and are target and goal driven
  • Creative flair, sense of style and a great understanding of Social Media and E-Commerce
  • Ability to think outside the box and passion to try new things
  • 5+ years of Ecommerce marketing experience in B2C environment is preferred
  • Proven track record in creating and executing innovative and effective marketing campaigns to drive sales, exposure and creative virality
  • Expertise in current online marketing and social media concepts, strategy and best practices
  • Strong planning, organisational and communication skills
  • Ability to work with cross-functional teams to execute campaigns
  • Ability to work effectively and autonomously
  • Ability to share knowledge and work in a team, but also be a self-start to hit individual goals
  • Experience with managing marketing campaigns for CPA targets
  • Experience in international markets (The US, Europe) is a distinct advantage
  • Genuine interest in Skincare, Beauty and/or Wellness industries; previous experience is an advantage

\xa0

In return you will get


  • Be part of a revolutionary Social E-Commerce company
  • Flat hierarchy and co-operative working atmosphere
  • Freedom to execute own ideas
  • Competitive package

\xa0

This job has everything for the right applicant, and is available immediately.

All applications will be treated confidentially.

Job description

The Opportunity

This leading Australian retail organisation with a presence in every state and territory is looking for a State Safety Manager to lead a team of advisors in delivering best-practice HSE management. A great opportunity to get your foot in the door, this six month contract has become available due to an internal secondment.

\xa0

The Role

Reporting to the GM Health and Safety and working within a dedicated, highly skilled HSE team in their Australian operations, this role offers an opportunity for a senior HSE professional to provide interim leadership within the region during an exciting time of growth and change for the organisation.

\xa0

To be successful you must bring:

  • Experience driving HSE cultural change in an operational environment and have strong resilience in people management
  • Systems Implementation experience
  • Strong mentoring and leadership skills with proven ability to coach and influence
  • Experience in FMCG, retail and distribution centres will be highly regarded
  • OHS qualifications and hands-on operational experience
  • Ability to influence safety across all employees

\xa0

The Rewards

A competitive day rate is on offer for candidates with relevant tertiary qualifications and industry exposure. For the right individual, this role offers a potentially career-defining opportunity to step into a key HSE leadership role with an industry-leading organisation. \xa0
